reviews.excerpt: I'm allergic to almonds and I still ate it, because - fuck it - it was that good! By the way, if you are a true foodie, you'll work through your allergies... just like the time my throat was closing when I ate macadamia-encrusted opa and thoroughly enjoying it as if it were my last meal on earth!
First they checked in with me to ensure that I did not have any allergies or foods that I disliked.
as our first snack, they offered me almond wheat crackers over bread

we asked not to be served mushrooms (there was one mushroom appetizer on the menu). An interesting idea is that they serve two different appetizers at once, so you can try more things. One of the first appetizers that came out was.. a fried mushroom. The waitress acknowledged she knew we didn't like it but thought it would be interesting for us to try it.
almond tortellini [which we'd later have with dinner]

reviews.excerpt: He made an effort to go back and forth between our table and the kitchen to make sure that nothing contained her specified food allergen.

I recommend the Stache pizza the most, with an unconventional blend of arugula and pistachio powder.
